definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: I showed up at the campsite one morning to find them loading their carts.
sentences.chinese: 一天早晨，我在营地发现他们正往大篷车里搬家什。

sentences.english: A jest falls from the speechless caravan.
sentences.chinese: 寂静的大篷车传来一阵暴笑。

sentences.english: Christine and Darryl were staying at a caravan Park on Palmers Island.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯蒂和达瑞尔是住在大篷车公园帕尔默斯岛。

sentences.english: Elisa stood in front of her wire fence watching the slow progress of the caravan.
sentences.chinese: 伊利莎站在铁栅栏前，看着大篷车慢慢走远。

sentences.english: A wagon rumbled over the ground.
sentences.chinese: 一辆大篷车辘辘地驶过场地。

sentences.english: And this boy's singing songs about the boxcar ?
sentences.chinese: 而这孩子还在唱什么大篷车的歌？
他们结队在埃及坐大篷车旅行。

definition: (theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances/abbr. for 巡迴演出|巡回演出[xun2 hui2 yan3 chu1]
special train/abbr. for 專門列車|专门列车[zhuan1 men2 lie4 che1]
the two mass scuttling operations carried out by the German navy: the scuttling of the German fleet at Scapa Flow in 1919 and Operation Regenbogen, the scuttling of U-boats in 1945
The Sound of Music, Broadway musical (1959) and Academy Award-winning movie (1965)
